column4:
5 g per day higher salt intake (2000 mg of sodium) is associated with a 17% greater risk of total cardiovascular
disease, and, crucially a 23% greater risk of stroke
column5: High dietary salt has detrimental effects on blood pressure and cardiovascular outcomes
column6: lowering dietary salt intake has the potential to save millions of lives globally by substantially reducing levels of heart disease and strokes
column8: CUTTING salt consumption by just half a teaspoon a day could save 20,000 lives
column9: REDUCING salt intake by a third would save millions of lives worldwide
column13: Cutting salt consumption by half a teaspoon a day could save 20,000 lives every year
column32: 15% cut in consumption could save 8.5 million lives
column39: Cutting salt intake by just half a teaspoon a day could save 20,000 lives
